page.title: 13Friars Farm (2)
page.content: To save time and money, when they are spraying the crops, they have a small tank which they fill with chemicals and its taken down to the fields and pumped straight into the crop sprayer. Their crop spraying tractor was covered in little things that looked like sesame seeds - these were in fact corn petals. The only disaster they could recall was when they filled the an old stable too high with grain and the weight of it pushed the stone walls out. They are on mains water but during heavy demand they use water from a well. The Forest Way goes across their land. There are various deciduous trees such as oak, maple and chestnut and the hedges are mainly hawthorn and small ash. Wildlife on the farm include foxes, hares, rabbits, owls, pheasants, patridges and wild ducks.
